availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James P. Bates (Barren Co, Ky, attorney and prov govt)

body.p: Barren County, Kentucky, attorney and politician. Virginia native. Married to Harriet Bates. Father of Virginia Bates, William Bates, James Bates, John Bates, George Bates, Edward Bates, and Frank Bates. Attorney in Barren County, Kentucky, in 1850. Member of the convention of the provisional government held at Russellville in November 1861. Elected member of the Council of Ten for the provisional government. Served as Chairman on the Ways and Means Committee for the Provisional Government of Kentucky. Served on the Committee on Military Affairs for the Provisional Government of Kentucky.

ab.bibl:
Lewis Collins and Richard Collins, History of Kentucky, vol. 1 (Collins & Company, 1882), 353.
H. Levin, The Lawyers and Lawmakers of Kentucky (Chicago: The Lewis Publishing Company, 1897), 468.
“Douglas Sentiments,” Daily Courier (Louisville, Ky.), October 19, 1860.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Barren County, 331A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Barren County, District No 2, p. 157.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, Bowling Green Precinct, p. 31A.
